components.description: The letter T, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter T

components.description: The letter A, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter A

description: The flag for Tristan da Cunha, which may show as the letters TA on some platforms. Apple devices show the St. Helena flag for both Ascension Island and Tristan Da Cunha.
title: Flag: Tristan Da Cunha

emoji_net_data.definition: The flag for Tristan da Cunha, which may show as the letters TA on some platforms.Â This same flag is used for Ascension Island andÂ St. Helen http://emojipedia.org/flag-for-tristan-da-cunha/
emoji_net_data.name: Tristan da Cunha

bn:02488931n: Group of British islands in the south Atlantic Ocean.
A remote group of islands in the South Atlantic; a dependency of the British overseas territory of Saint Helena
Tristan da Cunha, colloquially Tristan, is both a remote group of volcanic islands in the south Atlantic Ocean and the main island of that group.

bn:00034960n: Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design

note: This emoji was found in merged_emojis_before_fluentui but not in FluentUI
apple_vendor_description: Apple renders the flag of Tristan da Cunha with crisp detail, featuring a deep blue ensign adorned with the Union Jack in the canton and the island's coat of arms.  The coat of arms, with its shield and seabirds, is depicted with Apple's signature realistic lighting and subtle glossy shading, giving it a sense of depth and importance.  This unique flag emoji, with its smooth, rounded edges, signifies origins, travel, or a connection to this remote South Atlantic island.
